page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content:
{ LEIGH, BRANSFORD AND COTHERIDGE
This area is approximately 6.5 kilometres west of Worcester City in the county of Hereford and Worcester. It is an agricultural area with the main centres of{population}clustered near the church at Leigh and the school at Bransford. In the past it was a hop and fruit growing area but nowadays the chief crops are cereals and grassland. The{Leigh Brook}flows in a north easterly direction to join the{River {Teme,}which flows west to east towards Worcester and its confluence with the {River Severn. The south east of the area is cut by the A4103 Hereford to Worcester road.
